0.title: ONE DIRECTION

An old joke answers "How do you get to Carnegie Hall?" with this 8-letter word

2.title: SPORTS TALK
clues: In sewing it's a paper model of a garment; in football it's a receiver's route
When Michael Phelps talks about the 200 fly, he means a race using this stroke
Try a jumper from beyond the 3-point line & you're shooting the basketball from this part of a city
At this baseball position, having a great cutter can make you a star
(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from a soccer field in Johannesburg, South Africa) Leaping almost upside-down to volley the ball overhead, makes this reverse kick one of soccer's most exciting plays

clues: This Kellogg's cereal also comes in a gluten-free variety made with brown rice--but still with the same beloved sound

A third Olympic gold put Misty May-Treanor on boxes of this in 2012
Cap'n Crunch came out in 1963; by the end of the decade, Crunch Berries & this other flavor hit the shelves

4.title: MEMBERS OF MI FAMILIA
clues: The main man: el padre
I hear the pitter-patter of their feet: los hijos
I love her like one of these because she is one: la hermana
He let me get away with stuff parents wouldn't: el tio
You may call him pappy, but he's this: el abuelo

1998 brought the "agreement" named for this holiday to Northern Ireland; just in time for Easter!

8.title: MEET THE MONOTREMES!
clues: Monotremes are the only egg-layers of all these creatures, which include muskrats, moose & mankind
Monotreme means 3 internal canals lead to 1 common opening, same as in this scaly class of land animals
For the flat feature projecting from the animal's face, this word sometimes comes before platypus
The bug-loving echidna is also known as the spiny this
The short-beaked echidna is native to Australia; the long-beaked one, to this island

9.title: AFTER SCHOOL

10.title: JEWISH STARS

clues: I'm in this White House nexus of information; who's got the first question?
